page.title: 14TRANSPORT _ N.DEVON LINK RD.
page.content: {From Intersection 27 on M5 to Tiverton What were the effects of the New Link Road on local people? { Farmers:}They agreed that it was necessary, but they lost land and were not pleased. {Transport firms:}Whitbread Brewery & Heathcoat Textiles agreed that deliveries were now quicker and fuel was being saved. { Police:}In favour, traffic survey on Blundells Road shows a drop from 6490 vehicles, per day, before Link Road opened to 3730 after. Accidents were cut from 25 in 1983_84 to 18 in 1984-85. {Traders:}Stated there was less noise and traffic, but some transient trade was lost. { Conclusion:}Many approved of the link road, despite loss of land and trade to some people.
